ARABIC: وَٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا وَءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But as for those who do evil actions and then subsequently make tawba and have iman, in that case your Lord is Ever-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet those who do wrong, then repent and believe, are forgiven, for your Lord is forgiving and kind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for those who do evil, and later repent and have faith, such shall find their Lord All-Forgiving, All-Compassionate after (they repent and believe)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: To those who commit bad deeds, but, then, repent and believe (in God), Your Lord will certainly be All-forgiving and All-merciful."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And those who performed misdeeds and then repented and accepted faith – so after that, your Lord is Oft Forgiving, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But those who committed evil deeds and then repented afterwards and believed, verily, your Lord after (all) that is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And (as to) those who do evil deeds, then repent after that and believe, your Lord after that is most surely Forgiving, Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And those who do evil deeds, then repent thereafter and believe, surely thereafter thy Lord is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But those who do ill-deeds and afterward repent and believe - lo! for them, afterward, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: As for those who committed evils, and thereafter repented and believed, they shall find your Lord forgiving and merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And those who committed evils, and repented thereafter and believed --verily thy Lord is thereafter Forgiving, Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Yet [to] those who commit misdeeds but repent after that, and believe—indeed, after that, your Lord shall surely be all-forgiving, all-merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But those who do wrong but repent thereafter and (truly) believe,- verily thy Lord is thereafter Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But those who committed evil deeds and then repented afterwards and believed, verily, your Lord after (all) that is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: As for those who do evil and later repent and believe, your Lord is Forgiving, the Most Merciful thereafter.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for those who commit sins, and then repent afterwards and believe—your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [7:153] But those who commit evil deeds and repent, desist from them, thereafter and believe, in God — indeed your Lord thereafter, that is, after repentance, is truly Forgiving, Merciful’, towards them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 174 (But those who do ill deeds) while ascribing partners to Allah (and afterward repent) after their idolatry; it is also said that this means: after committing transgressions (and believe) profess Allah's divine Oneness and believe in Allah (lo! for them, afterward) after repentance and accepting faith, (your Lord) Moses; and it is also said: Muhammad (is Forgiving) He overlooks sins, (Merciful).
